result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrell M. Wise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrell M. Wise is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terrell M. Wise was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrell M. Wise

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2- Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made. DE is sentenced to 43 days in the KCJ forthwith and is given credit for 43 days - TIME SERVED.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.  Court costs also ordered.  Cash Bond on deposit in 13CF788, 14CF1415, 15CF157 and 15CF748 is to be applied and any remaining balance may be paid during supervision in other files.   If any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
received from Defendant

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. DE in person in custody with Attorney Hans Koesser. 
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing. DE advised of rights. Plea placed on record. Probable cause found. Information filed; reading waived. Pleas of not guilty entered. Case bound over to Branch 8. Pretrial 11/5 at 11:00 to trail DE other cases.
Bond continued
